intro: Trichomanes hispidum, commonly known as the hairy maidenhair fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that are covered in fine, hairy structures, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Trichomanes hispidum plays a role in maintaining ecological balance by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
